title: Where does Milton Williams rank among Patriots’ 10 best free-agent signings ever?
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Milton Williams ranks eighth among the Patriots' top 10 free-agent signings after a strong 2025 season.
Williams signed a four-year, $104 million deal and helped lead the Patriots to Super Bowl LX with 5.5 sacks.
His quick pressures in the postseason were second only to Aaron Donald, enhancing his impact for the Patriots.

title: 8 lesser discussed potential trade deadline candidates that could make sense for Celtics
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Celtics unlikely to make major moves before trade deadline, focusing on adding rather than selling.
Celtics consider Nic Claxton from Nets and Daniel Gafford from Mavericks for their big man needs.
Other potential targets include Keon Ellis, Yyves Missi, Dayâ€™Ron Sharpe, Andre Drummond, Isaiah Jackson, and Goga Bitadze.

title: Something in the Way Fest 2026: Live updates from Roadrunner
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: The two-day 'Something in the Way' festival at Boston's Roadrunner features indie and alt-rock bands on January 31 and February 1.
Brooklyn-based band Momma donates merchandise proceeds to the Immigrant Law Center of Minnesota during the festival.
Las Vegas screamo band Febuary intensifies the festival with a hardcore performance, generating crowd enthusiasm and mosh pits.

title: Why the Bruins practiced in a tent on Saturday in Florida
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Boston Bruins practiced under a large tent at Raymond James Stadium to protect the ice for an outdoor NHL game.
The NHL built a 34-foot high, state-of-the-art tent to maintain ice quality against Florida's warm, humid conditions.
Sunday's game forecast in Tampa predicts temperatures in the 30s, colder than Boston's 2023 Winter Classic puck-drop weather.

title: Boston ‘ICE Out Everywhere’ protest must-see moments
author: Annie Jonas and Samantha Genzer
bullets: Thousands protested in Boston for 'ICE Out Everywhere,' demanding an end to cooperation with ICE and stronger immigrant protections.
The rally was part of a national campaign in over 300 cities, inspired by recent deaths at the hands of ICE agents.
Boston Teachers Union and other groups participated, urging Governor Healey to prevent ICE operations in sensitive locations like schools.

title: Photos from Boston’s ‘ICE Out Everywhere’ protest
author: Kelly Chan
bullets: Over 1,000 people protested Trump's immigration policies at Boston Common on January 31, despite the cold weather.
Boston's 'ICE Out Everywhere' protest involved Mass 50501 and other local groups, following a national series of events.
The protest featured signs, a band performance at the State House, and participants carrying anti-ICE messages.

title: Insider believes Red Sox have ‘another move in them’ this offseason to improve infield
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Red Sox may pursue another infielder despite upcoming spring training, with trades potentially involving Isaac Paredes or Christian Walker.
ESPN's Jeff Passan notes Red Sox's interest in defensive infield help over power, mentioning Isaac Paredes as a potential fit.
Red Sox exploring trade options with Cubs and others, checking on players like Nico Hoerner, but Cubs unlikely to trade him.

title: Even Drake Maye’s dad is surprised by Patriots’ Super Bowl run
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots reach Super Bowl LX, surprising many including Drake Maye's father who expected playoffs, not Super Bowl.
Drake Maye led Patriots' turnaround with MVP-caliber season, posting 72% completion, 113.5 passer rating, 4,394 yards, and 31 TDs.
Despite weak postseason, Patriots advance to face Seahawks in Super Bowl LX; Maye family to attend, hoping Luke arrives from Japan.

title: That guy on TV, Cris Collinsworth, will look familiar to Patriots fans tuning into NBC to watch the Super Bowl
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Cris Collinsworth and Mike Tirico will call Super Bowl LX for NBC, featuring the Patriots against the Seahawks.
Collinsworth has broadcasted five Patriots Super Bowls, including their previous matchup with the Seahawks 11 seasons ago.
Super Bowl LX marks Collinsworth's 53rd Patriots game as a broadcaster, highlighting his extensive experience with the team.

title: Mass. snowplow driver who spotted legs sticking out of snowbank praised for saving older man
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Massachusetts snowplow driver Matty McGarry spotted legs sticking out of a snowbank and saved an older man in Auburn.
The man fell headfirst into a 3-foot snowbank while walking home after watching a Patriots game during a snowstorm.
McGarry will receive a commendation from the Auburn Board of Selectmen for his quick response and rescue.
